data.title: String transformation
data.solution:
source = gets.chomp
target = gets.chomp

puts source
(0..source.size).each{|i|
	if source[i] != target[i]
		source[i] = target[i]
		puts source
	end
}
data.statement:
Given two strings of the same length, your task is to transform one into the other by changing one character at a time, from left to right. Do not print duplicate transformations when characters of both words at corresponding position matches.

For example, if the strings are "bubble gum" and "turtle ham", the transformation goes as follows:
`bubble gum
tubble gum
turble gum
turtle gum
turtle hum
turtle ham`

testCases.title: Example
testCases.testOut:
bubble gum
tubble gum
turble gum
turtle gum
turtle hum
turtle ham

testCases.title: Example
testCases.testOut:
full house
lull house
loll house
loul house
loud house
loud nouse
loud noise

testCases.title: One word
testCases.testOut:
sayonara
seyonara
seronara
serenara
serenira
serenita
serenity

testCases.title: Spaces
testCases.testIn:
it is a miracle
i got a monocle
testCases.testOut:
it is a miracle
i  is a miracle
i gis a miracle
i gos a miracle
i got a miracle
i got a moracle
i got a monacle
i got a monocle

testCases.title: Spaces
testCases.testIn:
somebody is here
do not interfere
testCases.testOut:
somebody is here
domebody is here
do ebody is here
do nbody is here
do noody is here
do notdy is here
do not y is here
do not i is here
do not inis here
do not ints here
do not inte here
do not interhere
do not interfere

testCases.title: Not just letters
testCases.testIn:
aren't you worried?
prepare our troops!
testCases.testOut:
aren't you worried?
pren't you worried?
prep't you worried?
prepat you worried?
prepar you worried?
prepareyou worried?
prepare ou worried?
prepare ourworried?
prepare our orried?
prepare our trried?
prepare our troied?
prepare our trooed?
prepare our troopd?
prepare our troops?
prepare our troops!

testCases.title: Not just letters
testCases.testIn:
let's go home!
lego for homer
testCases.testOut:
let's go home!
leg's go home!
legos go home!
lego  go home!
lego fgo home!
lego foo home!
lego for home!
lego for homer

data.constraints:
0 < length of [[source]] < 100
length of [[source]] == length of [[target]]
data.stubGenerator:
read source:string(100)
read target:string(100)
write answer
data.outputDescription: The transformation starting with [[source]] and ending with [[target]], one line representing one step.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given two strings of the same length, your task is to transform one into the other by changing one character at a time, from left to right. Do not print duplicate transformations when characters of both words at corresponding position matches.

For example, if the strings are "bubble gum" and "turtle ham", the transformation goes as follows:
bubble gum
tubble gum
turble gum
turtle gum
turtle hum
turtle ham
Input
Line 1: a string source
Line 2: a string target
Output
The transformation starting with source and ending with target, one line representing one step.
Constraints
0 < length of source < 100
length of source == length of target
Example
Input
bubble gum
turtle ham
Output
bubble gum
tubble gum
turble gum
turtle gum
turtle hum
turtle ham
